Tiltfile API Reference¶

class api.Image¶

A built Docker image

cache()¶

Caches the given path between image builds.

Popular directories to cache include:

  • Go projects: /root/.cache/go-build
  • NodeJS projects: /src/node_modules, /src/yarn.lock
Parameters:path (str) – The path to cache. May be a file or a directory.
Return type:None
class api.LocalPath¶

A path on disk

class api.Service¶

Represents a Kubernetes service that Tilt can deploy and monitor.

port_forward(local, remote=0)¶

Sets up port-forwarding for the deployed container when it’s ready.

Parameters:
  • local (int) – The local port
  • remote (int) – The container port. If not specified, we will forward to the first port in the container
api.add(src, dest)¶

Adds the content from src into the image at path dest.

Return type:None
api.composite_service(services)¶

Creates a composite service; tilt will deploy (and watch) all services returned by the functions in service_fns.

Return type:Service
api.global_yaml(yaml)¶

Call this on the top level of your Tiltfile with a string of YAML.

We will infer what (if any) of the k8s resources defined in your YAML correspond to Services defined elsewhere in your Tiltfile (matching based on the DockerImage ref and on pod selectors). Any remaining YAML is global YAML, i.e. YAML that Tilt applies to your k8s cluster independently of any Service you define.

Parameters:yaml (str) – YAML as a string
Return type:None
api.k8s_service(img, yaml='')¶

Creates a kubernetes service that tilt can deploy using the the image passed in.

Parameters:
  • img (Image) – A Docker image.
  • yaml (str) – An optional Kubernetes resource YAML. If the YAML is not passed, we expect to be able to extract it from global_yaml().
Return type:

Service
api.kustomize(pathToDir)¶

Run kustomize on a given directory and return the resulting YAML.

Return type:str
api.local(cmd)¶

Runs cmd, waits for it to finish, and returns its stdout.

Return type:str
api.local_git_repo(path)¶

Creates a repo from the git repo at path.

Return type:Repo
api.read_file(file_path)¶

Reads file and returns its contents.

Parameters:file_path (Union[str, LocalPath]) – Path to the file locally
Return type:str
api.run(cmd, trigger=[])¶

Runs cmd as a build step in the image.

Parameters:
  • cmd (str) – A shell command.
  • trigger (Union[List[str], str]) – If the trigger argument is specified, the build step is only run on changes to the given file(s).
Return type:

None
api.start_fast_build(dockerfile_path, img_name, entrypoint='')¶

Initiates a docker image build that supports add s and run s, and that uses a cache for subsequent builds.

TODO(dmiller): explain how this is fast, and image vs container builds?

TODO(dmiller): explain the concept of the active build

Return type:None
api.static_build(dockerfile, ref, build_args={}, context='')¶

Builds a docker image.

Parameters:
  • dockerfile (str) – The path to a Dockerfile
  • ref (str) – e.g. a blorgdev/backend or gcr.io/project-name/bucket-name
  • build_args (Dict[str, str]) – the build-time variables that are accessed like regular environment variables in the RUN instruction of the Dockerfile. See the Docker Build Arg documentation
  • context (str) – The path to use as the Docker build context. Defaults to the Dockerfile directory.
Return type:

Image
api.stop_build()¶

Closes the currently active build (started by start_fast_build()).

Returns a container Image that has all of the adds and runs applied.

Return type:Image
